Body:
I was looking for the AOT implementation at https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler and there is good documentation around.

How do we can achieve AOT using IONIC CLI for Mobile browser apps?

"
As far as I'm aware aot has been the default since beta 11 source: [this blog post](http://blog.ionic.io/announcing-ionic-2-beta-11/)
My question is for Mobile Browsers apps, it is not specific to Android(APK) or Ios (IOS) or hybrid apps.
As said by @0mpurdy it's by default aot compiled, but you can always ensure that it's compiling AOT by using --aot flag when building your app. This flag can be used since app-scripts 0.0.47 version.
Thank you for the quick response. 	My question is for Mobile Browsers apps, it is not specific to Android (APK) or Ios (IOS) or hybrid.
@Kanchan [this forum post](https://forum.ionicframework.com/t/aot-compilation-is-not-obvious-for-new-users/87114) suggests that perhaps `npm run build --aot` is what you're looking for
Thank you @Gabriel. 		I have found the following command working perfectly for me.		     npm run build --prod --aot
@Kanchan you're welcome :D glad it worked. Can you mark my answer as correct? Thanks
@Kanchan if you're using the browser platform (`ionic platform add browser`) you can use all flags available in app-scripts. Or as sugested by 0mpurdy do a `npm run build --aot`.

In case someone needs to do AOT build ionic for mobile browser following command work fine - 

npm run build --prod --aot

When ionic cordova run android --aot this command is not working follow this things.

If you have more then one page remove all page module.ts file then remove IonicPage() inside .ts file.

I hope It may help you.
